page.title: 03Leisure in Viewpark
page.content: In our area there are several things for children to join in. There are the Brownies and Guides for girls, Scouts and Cubs for boys for example. In local school halls you can go to a disco on Fridays or a youth club on Mondays. Viewpark's pubs and clubs are very popular with the adults and are all found along the main road. Some are 'The Stag','Royal Oak' and the 'Ashley'. Although Uddingston is bigger than Viewpark it has about the same number of pubs; some are the ''Anvil', 'Angels' and the 'Bay Horse'. Quite a lot of men keep racing pigeons usually in a hut or 'loft' in the back garden. Greyhounds are also popular and are used for racing too. You can often see men walking them for exercise along roads and parks.
